thread.title: 17 Things To Do In London That Don’t Involve Alcohol
thread.title_full: 17 Things To Do In London That Don’t Involve Alcohol

author: Ailbhe Malone
title: 17 Things To Do In London That Don’t Involve Alcohol

organizations.name: london drinks to order when you

text:
View this image › 
Flight Club This “social darts” club in Old Street is super-fun and super-straightforward. The set-up is more like bowling than anything else (ie the scores are computerised, and the rules come up on a computer screen), and the staff are very helpful if you’re a newbie.
The other bonus is that they have a smashing non-alcoholic menu. There’s the usual soft drinks, but also interesting offerings from Fentiman’s, Bottlegreen and Schweppes. 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289710 2. Jarr Bar Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Jarr’s Bar is located on the Crate Brewery compound near Hackney Wick, and is a (deep breath) kombucha tap room. You can get kombucha flavoured with ginger, fresh raspberry or passion fruit, and then head next door to Crate to pick up a pizza. 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289711 3. Visit Waterstone’s in Picadilly View this image › 
Waterstones This branch has loads of free events in the evenings – from readings to swing dance classes, and their café stays open pretty late too (until 9.30pm).
Find out more here .
ID: 10289712 4. Drink Shop & Do View this image › 
drinkshopdo.com This King’s Cross institution has something for everyone. They serve all kinds of tea and cake until late, host plenty of hand-on crafting activities, and the racuous but fun Musical Bingo . In terms of drinks, they have a fantastic virgin cocktail menu: go for the Virgin Front Garden (basil, elderflower, apple and lime). 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289713 5. Bar Kick View this image › 
Bar Kick With locations in Shoreditch and Exmouth Market, Bar Kick is a great way to while away an evening. It’s table football-focused, with some Spanish snacks, and it’s astonishingly cheap – only £1 a game. House rules say winner stays on, unless you’ve discussed otherwise. 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289716 6. Discover an ~escape the room~ game. View this image › 
Enigma Quests There are plenty of these escape rooms in London, but these are the two I really rate:
School of Witchcraft and Wizardy : A Harry Potter -inspired game where you have to pass your OWLs. Prices from £30 a head.
Time Run : A next-level hyper-real escape challenge. This was so good that once I completed it, I kept refreshing the page for the next installment so I could book. Prices from £30 a head.
ID: 10289719 7. Swingers Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com This crazy golf course near Liverpool Street is 10/10 for fun, but really, we’re here to talk about the food. They’ve got residencies from Pizza Pilgrims, Patty and Bun AND Hoppers. They also have some interesting non-alcoholic drinks, like watermelon and cucumber soda (yum!)
Find out more here .
ID: 10289723 8. Go wild with a luxurious hot chocolate. View this image › 
Chin Chin Labs Here are 17 places to hit up .
ID: 10289737 9. Visit a fancy bar. Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Just because you don’t want to drink alcohol, it doesn’t mean you can’t go to a bar. Here are 18 London Drinks To Order When You’re Not Drinking .
ID: 10289739 10. Go to the cinema. View this image › 
Screen on the Green Here’s our faves: 17 Charming Cinemas In London You Must See Before You Die .
ID: 10289742 11. Have a treetop adventure. Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Go Ape has locations in Battersea and in Cockfosters, and is the most fun you can have while strapped into a climbing harness. Despite the premise, it’s really accessible for all, and the staff are happy to try and help any way they can. 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289744 12. Go for Bubble Tea at Biju . View this image › 
Laura Gallant at BuzzFeed Sweet sweet bubble tea, with infinite toppings and flavour combos. 
Not into Biju? Here are some more options: 21 Places You Must Drink Bubble Tea Before You Die 
ID: 10289746 13. Four Quarters Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com This arcade bar in Peckham is loaded with games (shoutout Miss Pacman!) and good vibes. In terms of non-alcoholic drinks, it’s the regular Cokes and so on – but with games like these, we can let that slide.
Find out more here .
ID: 10289749 14. Draughts Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com This board game bar in Haggerston is the epitome of chill. There are some nice soft drinks from Dalston Cola, but our recc is to grab a 10/10 hot chocolate and settle down with Catan . 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289751 15. Visit the cat café . Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Lady Dinah’s Cat Emporium in Bethnal Green! They also offer speciality coffees, like the salted caramel chai! I don’t know what more I can tell you! 
Find out more here .
ID: 10289755 16. Bounce View this image › 
Facebook: bouncepingpong With locations in Old Street and Farringdon, you can play ping pong all night long. Bounce is loads of fun, and they have an extensive virgin cocktail list. The RnR Spritz looks especially good: elderflower, raspberry, rhubarb and soda. 
Find out more here .
ID: 10290395 17. Try out pottery classes. Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Hackney City Farm offers drop-in pottery classes on Wednesdays and Thursdays. It’s £15 per person, and that includes kiln fees.
ID: 10290412   
Ailbhe
